TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Jose Antonio Navarro, 12-24-1829

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to José Antonio Navarro, December 24, 1829. Thinks Navarro's income as collector of customhouse at Galveston will be small. Future depends on policy of the Government. Late decree concerning slavery retards development. Commerce in the colony.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: From the Lamar Papers, Texas State Library. The translation has been revised in, comparison with the original, which is also in the collection.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 302-303

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to José Antonio Navarro, December 24, 1829. Thinks Navarro's income as collector of customhouse at Galveston will be small. Future depends on policy of the Government. Late decree concerning slavery retards development. Commerce in the colony.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="12-24-1829">24th of December [1829]*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*My esteemed *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*:—*/p*
*p*I received your letter of the *date_mentioned n="11-29-1829">29th of last month*/date_mentioned* and I give you my sincere thanks for the just reflections that you make relative to the loss by early death of my *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned*. The mail arrived very late and is now leaving and I have not time to write much.*/p*
*p*In regard to the employment that the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*has given to you as *person_mentioned*administrator [of the port] of Galveston*/person_mentioned* I believe like you that for some time it will not produce sufficient to live upon. If it shall or shall not be productive in the future depends entirely on the progress of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, and it appears that this is doubtful on account of the last decrees sent out by the *person_mentioned*legislature */person_mentioned*extraordinary and unknown in the Constitution which has been established in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*. I think if the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*was well established the office would be of sufficient consideration.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*father-in-law of Don Samuel*/person_mentioned* lives on *location_mentioned*San Jacinto*/location_mentioned*, and has a boat suitable for going from the landing on that *location_mentioned*river */location_mentioned*to the *person_mentioned*island of Galveston*/person_mentioned*. If you think of making a visit you can do so in this way without difficulty. The *location_mentioned*Island */location_mentioned*is depopulated and I am of the opinion that now the *location_mentioned*custom House*/location_mentioned* should be at *location_mentioned*Brazoria*/location_mentioned* on the *location_mentioned*Brazos*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*The 75 lbs. of Coffee are in *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*and as soon as *person_mentioned*Soe*/person_mentioned* comes I will see that he takes it if he can do so.*/p*
*p*I cannot say positively when the vessel will leave for *location_mentioned*Orleans*/location_mentioned*. The interest which my *person_mentioned*brother */person_mentioned*had in her has been sold—I will write to *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*upon this particular and will advise you.*/p*
*p*I shall be much pleased to see you here. I live with *person_mentioned*Don Samuel */person_mentioned*and you must come direct to our *location_mentioned*jacal */location_mentioned*it is *location_mentioned*one mile from the villeta*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I shall not speak of the last letters, because I have no time to answer them by this mail. I shall rest in the confidence and wisdom of the *person_mentioned*authorities */person_mentioned*there. The memorial of our worthy *person_mentioned*chief of department*/person_mentioned* is most helpful, and can not fail to carry much influence.*/p*
*p*By the next mail I shall write to you about your estimate concerning lands and shall only say now that if I can get the money I shall return the estimate.*/p*
*p*In regard to the decrees I shall only say that in not more than one or two months at most notices of them will be spread through the *location_mentioned*Gazetas of Orleans*/location_mentioned* for from there they will receive notices every day from *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Tampico */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Matamoras*/location_mentioned*. I doubt not that there are some in *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*whom, I shall see and speak to of this matter with pleasure.*/p*
*p*Give my respects to your *person_mentioned*brothers */person_mentioned*and to *person_mentioned*Mr. Ruiz*/person_mentioned* and to your *person_mentioned*father*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Your friend *person_mentioned*E. F. Austin.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*(P. S.) I forgot to say that you can come with mules and horses, I think the first you can sell for money although this is an article which is very scarce, and there is no certain market for anything in money.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*E. F. A.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Addressed to *person_mentioned*Jose Antonio Navarro*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Bejar*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
